newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Mabuhay lifts stake in Interport.
newsitem.headline: Mabuhay lifts stake in Interport.

text.p: Mabuhay Holdings Corp said on Tuesday its subsidiary T&M Holdings Inc had bought 4.4 billion shares of real estate firm Interport Resources Corp, bringing Mabuhay's direct and indirect stake in it to 43.6 percent.
Prior to the purchase, Mabuhay owned 32.6 percent of Interport. Most of the shares were held by T&M Holdings Inc, a company organised to buy into Interport.
Mabuhay bought the new shares from various stakeholders.

Mabuhay director Andrew Bell said in a statement to the Philippine Stock Exchange the company decided to buy more Interport shares even if differences with the incumbent management team remained unresolved.
Interport management nullified all proxy forms of Mabuhay during its stockholders' meeting last July, blocking Mabuhay's bid to take over the operation of the firm.
"Mabuhay could do two things, one was to move backward or retreat or move forward. It must have made a decision to advance," Bell said.
Mabuhay is a holding company with interests in real estate, power and shipping.
